_header: O ye my lords when ye behold
Title(s): Kalundare of John Shirley which he sett in ye biginninge of his booke
_description: John Shirley, ‘Kalundare of John Shirley which he sett in ye biginninge of his booke’ — 104 lines in couplets

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
O ye my lordes whan ye be holdethis boke or list it to
                    vnfould…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…be hit female be it malenow seche and rede some other
                    talle
BLAdd29729.Note:
Aftr ‘Explicit’ a note referring to several entries in the
                    volume: ‘Here endeth þe workes of Iohn lidgate which Iohn Stow hath
                    caused to be copyyed out of an owld booke somtyme wrytten by Iohn sherleye as is
                    aboue made mencyon Iohn sherley wrat in þe tyme of Iohn lydgate in his
                    lyffe tyme’ (f. 179).
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Kalundare of Iohn Shirley which he sett in þe beginninge of his booke
                    (f. 177v)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
Brusendorff,  Aage.

         Copenhagen, 1925; repr. Oxford: Clarendon, 1967: 457-60.
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             English Verse between Chaucer and Surrey.
         Durham, NC: Duke UP, 1927: 196-7.
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “Two Tapestry Poems by Lydgate: the Life of St. George and the Falls of
                Seven Princes.” 
             Englische Studie
         43 (1910-11): 10-26: 12 (extracts).
